comment: The cosine of the angle between ` X ` and ` -u Y ` is the negative of that between ` X ` and ` Y ` . If A, B and C are collinear points, this implies that the cosines of DBA and DBC sum to zero, i.e., that DBA and DBC are supplementary. (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
